legalStatus.loanTypeAllowed: Title Loans (Regulated under Florida Title Loan Act - Chapter 537)
legalStatus.restrictions: Must be licensed by Florida Office of Financial Regulation; Subject to strict tiered interest rate caps and comprehensive consumer protection requirements
legalStatus.notes: Florida has a dedicated Title Loan Act (Chapter 537) that provides comprehensive consumer protections. The law supersedes other state provisions regarding title loans to the extent of any conflict.

regulations.maxLoanAmount: $25,000 under Chapter 516; No specific cap under Chapter 537 (based on vehicle value)
regulations.maxAPR: Tiered rates: 30% on first $2,000; 24% on $2,000-$3,000; 18% on amounts over $3,000
regulations.rolloverLimit: No limit on number of extensions, but interest rate cannot exceed original rate
regulations.rolloverRestrictions: Each extension must be 30 days; Cannot capitalize unpaid interest into principal
regulations.interestCalculation: Simple interest only - add-on interest prohibited

fees.maxLatePaymentFee: $15 per month or $7.50 semi-monthly after 10 days delinquent
fees.maxNSFFee: Greater of $20 or actual bank charge
fees.prepaymentPenalty: None allowed - borrower may prepay at any time
fees.repossessionFees: Reasonable expenses only; must use licensed repossession agent
fees.otherFees: All fees must be disclosed in title loan agreement

rightToRescind.notes: Florida does not mandate a rescission period for title loans

requiredDisclosures: Make, model, year, and VIN of vehicle
Borrower name, address, date of birth, physical description, and SSN
Annual Percentage Rate (APR) per Truth in Lending Act
Name and physical address of title loan office
Florida OFR contact information for complaints
Statement regarding repossession rights and surplus proceeds
prohibitedPractices: Capitalizing unpaid interest into principal on extensions
Fraud, misrepresentation, or deceit in any transaction
Refusing to provide information to OFR
Aiding others in circumventing title loan laws
Acquiring borrower property through non-commercially reasonable means

collectionRules.gracePeriod: 30 days after maturity date (or extension) before repossession
collectionRules.priorNotice: Must offer borrower opportunity to make vehicle available
collectionRules.personalBelongings: Must allow borrower to remove personal belongings before repossession
collectionRules.saleNotice: 10 days written notice before sale required
collectionRules.saleMethod: Must sell through licensed motor vehicle dealer
collectionRules.surplusReturn: Must return surplus proceeds within 30 days of sale
collectionRules.redemptionRight: Borrower may redeem vehicle any time before sale by paying balance plus costs
collectionRules.purchaseAtSale: Borrower may purchase vehicle at any sale

penalties.excessInterestBonafideError: Loan voidable; lender must refund excess within 20 days of discovery
penalties.excessInterestCircumvention: Loan VOID; lender must refund ALL interest paid AND return property; lender forfeits right to collect principal
penalties.unlicensedLending: Loan VOID; lender forfeits all principal and interest; must return all payments plus property; borrower entitled to attorney fees
penalties.usury: Violation of Chapter 687 (Usury) with applicable penalties
penalties.licenseActions: Denial, suspension, revocation, probation, or reprimand

cityPageContent.headline: Understanding Title Loan Laws in Florida
cityPageContent.intro: Residents of {{city}} are protected by the Florida Title Loan Act (Chapter 537), which provides comprehensive consumer protections and strict interest rate caps for title loan borrowers.
keyPoints: Florida caps interest at 30% APR on the first $2,000, 24% on $2,000-$3,000, and 18% on amounts over $3,000
All title loan lenders must be licensed by the Florida Office of Financial Regulation
Initial loan term is 30 days, with extensions permitted by mutual consent
Lenders cannot capitalize unpaid interest into principal on extensions
If your vehicle is repossessed, you must receive 10 days notice before sale
You are entitled to surplus proceeds within 30 days of vehicle sale
You may redeem your vehicle any time before sale by paying balance plus costs
Verify lender license at flofr.gov or call (850) 487-9687
cityPageContent.disclaimer: This information is for general educational purposes only and may not reflect the most current legal developments. Laws and regulations change frequently. Always consult with a licensed attorney or contact the Florida Office of Financial Regulation at (850) 487-9687 or visit flofr.gov for the most accurate and up-to-date information before making any financial decisions.
